item.title: Jaguar Land Rover extends shutdown after cyberattack by another week
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) announced today that it will extend the production shutdown for another week, following a devastating cyberattack that impacted its systems at the end of August. [...]

item.title: Apple backports zero-day patches to older iPhones and iPads
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Apple has released security updates to backport patches released last month to older iPhones and iPads, addressing a zero-day bug that was exploited in "extremely sophisticated" attacks. [...]

item.title: New FileFix attack uses steganography to drop StealC malware
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A newly discovered FileFix social engineering attack impersonates Meta account suspension warnings to trick users into unknowingly installing the StealC infostealer malware. [...]

item.title: Webinar: Your browser is the breach — securing the modern web edge
item.dc:creator: BleepingComputer
item.description: The web browser has quietly become one of the most critical components of enterprise infrastructure—and one of the most dangerous. Join BleepingComputer, SC Media, and Push Security on September 29 at 12:00 PM ET for a live webinar on how attackers are targeting the browser to hijack sessions, steal data, and bypass security. [...]

item.title: OpenAI's new GPT-5 Codex model takes on Claude Code
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is rolling out the GPT-5 Codex model to all Codex instances, including Terminal, IDE extension, and Codex Web (codex.chatgpt.com). [...]

item.title: Google confirms fraudulent account created in law enforcement portal
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Google has confirmed that hackers created a fraudulent account in its Law Enforcement Request System (LERS) platform that law enforcement uses to submit official data requests to the company [...]

item.title: FinWise insider breach impacts 689K American First Finance customers
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: FinWise Bank is warning on behalf of corporate customers that it suffered a data breach after a former employee accessed sensitive files after the end of their employment. [...]

item.title: New Phoenix attack bypasses Rowhammer defenses in DDR5 memory
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: Academic researchers have devised a new variant of Rowhammer attacks that bypass the latest protection mechanisms on DDR5 memory chips from SK Hynix. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Exchange 2016 and 2019 reach end of support in 30 days
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has reminded administrators again that Exchange 2016 and Exchange 2019 will reach the end of extended support next month and has provided guidance for decommissioning outdated servers. [...]

item.title: Microsoft to force install the Microsoft 365 Copilot app in October
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Next month, Microsoft will begin automatically installing the Microsoft 365 Copilot app on Windows devices outside of the EEA region that have the Microsoft 365 desktop client apps. [...]

item.title: Stop waiting on NVD — get real-time vulnerability alerts now
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by SecAlerts
item.description: Vulnerabilities are discovered daily—but not every alert matters. SecAlerts pulls from 100+ sources for faster, real-time vuln alerts, filtering the noise so teams can patch quicker and stay secure. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Windows 11 audio issues confirmed in December
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has removed a safeguard hold that prevented some users from upgrading their systems to Windows 11 24H2 due to compatibility issues that were causing Bluetooth headsets and speakers to malfunction. [...]

item.title: Microsoft says Windows September updates break SMBv1 shares
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has confirmed that the September 2025 Windows security updates are causing connection issues to Server Message Block (SMB) v1 shares. [...]
